intro: Imperialis dagana, commonly known as the royal flame orchid, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It features vibrant orange and red petals that resemble flames, making it a visually stunning species. The plant has a sympodial growth habit, with each stem producing a cluster of showy flowers. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, adapted to capture maximum sunlight in its mountainous habitat. Imperialis dagana requires specific conditions, including cool temperatures and high humidity, to thrive.
